For example, the order of execution of the blocks may be changed, and/or the blocks may be changed, eliminated, or combined. FIGS. 4 The methods described above may be implemented as software programs for execution by one or more processors. Such programs may be embodied in software stored on a tangible medium such as CD-ROM, a floppy disk, a hard drive, a digital versatile disk (DVD), or a memory associated with the processor, but persons of ordinary skill in the art will readily appreciate that the entire program or parts thereof could alternatively be executed by a device other than a processor, and/or embodied in firmware and/or dedicated hardware in a well known manner.
